title: @Meddler Context on the Mord changes?
body:
http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/12/1210-pbe-update.html 

Mordekaiser
Iron Man (Passive) Shield decay per second reduced to 1.5% from 2%
Siphon of Destruction (E) damage increased to 45/75/105/135/165 from 35/65/95/125/155
Children of the Graves (R) ghost now gains (100% of Mordekaiser's bonus AD) attack damage instead of flat 10/25/50

I think the passive change was a step in the right direction, even if it's a little small to start with. The E base damage is a little random, but acceptable. 

What confuses me is the ultimate change; this is entirely out of the blue. Are you trying to encourage AD Mordekaiser? Why is his AP-tank build not approved of, and will there be further changes that make his AD playstyle the superior one, even if he lacks the incentive of itemization for it as opposed to what items like Rylai offer? 

Further, do you plan on addressing the most complained-about gripes, namely his abysmal base stats and the current state of Harvesters of Sorrow?

replies.body: They just made his ult a  more hybrid ability

does he really invest in AD right now, though?

the only item I can think of that most Mords will grab is Gunblade, and that's, what 40?
Mallet, Black cleaver and Tri force Are some other examples. He can use them but its best not to. IMO Ap Morde kicks over people better than Ad Morde.

Morde's been struggling since the preseason changes, so we're looking at ways to add power appropriately to him. Odds are though that not all of that change list will ship, we're trying a few things to see what delivers best. As far as the ult change goes we do want Morde to feel rewarded for choosing to use some AD items, so are looking at mechanics that support doing so.
The buff to decay rate is a must have

alright, i'm interested to see what you guys have planned for him

I'd really like to enjoy playing him again :(
